channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: How a Toledo tattoo artist helps turn scars into art
item.description: Brian Finn is a tattoo artist in Toledo, Ohio who has been offering free and discounted tattoos for people covering trauma scars for more than 10 years.Â

item.title: 'All Things Considered' bids farewell to host Ari Shapiro
item.description: All Things Considered is saying goodbye to Ari Shapiro, whose hosts his final show today following 10 years with the program and more than 25 with NPR.

item.title: Black liberation activist Assata Shakur has died at 78
item.description: Assata Shakur, a Black political activist who was convicted for killing a New Jersey state trooper and later exiled to Cuba, has died.

item.title: Redistricting could test Maryland Gov. Wes Moore's bipartisanship.
item.description: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore has committed to being a bipartisan bridgebuilder. But he's also under pressure to redistrict the state's one GOP congressman out of his House seat.

item.title: Neko Case returns with her first-ever entirely self-produced album
item.description: Neko Case has released her first solo album of the decade. It's also the first she's produced entirely herself, and speaks to her wide musical range.

item.title: The fake Anthropologie rock that fooled boyfriends everywhere
item.description: NPR's Mia Venkat explains to Ari Shapiro what the internet was obsessed with this week.

item.title: Trump announces a new round of tariffs
item.description: President Trump has ordered steep new tariffs on imported drugs, home furnishings, and trucks. The president's import taxes are pushing inflation higher. But that's not slowing consumer spending.

item.title: Makeup mogul Bobbi Brown talks about paving her own way in the industry
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Makeup mogul Bobbi Brown talks about paving her own way when her industry was dominated by men.

item.title: At the UN, Prime Minister Netanyahu is defiant as Israel's isolation grows
item.description: Outcry over the war in Gaza leaves Israel diplomatically isolated as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is due to address the U.N.

item.title: Jeff Tweedy on 'Twilight Override,' his new triple album
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Wilco front man Jeff Tweedy about his new triple solo album, Twilight Override, which examines the pandemic-related trauma he says we're all still dealing with.
